hook: The City of Santa Clara just dropped the hammer on commuters: Tasman Drive is officially locked down from January 28 to February 13, and if you're trusting your GPS to get you to the stadium, you are driving straight into a trap.

sections.title: The Tasman Wall: What 'Closed' Really Means
key_points: Define the hard closure zone from Convention Center to Great America Parkway.
Clarify that this is a total lockdown for private vehicles, not a soft checkpoint.
Highlight the extended duration of the closure (Jan 28 - Feb 13).
stats_facts: Tasman Drive is fully closed to private vehicles from Convention Center to Great America Parkway.
The closure runs continuously from Jan 28 through Feb 13.
VTA Light Rail is the only vehicle allowed to cross the Tasman/Great America intersection.
sections.transition: While the physical barricades are immovable, the digital world hasn't caught up yet, creating a massive headache for drivers.

sections.title: Why Waze Will Fail You
key_points: Explain the lag between physical closures and GPS app updates.
Describe the 'turn-around loop' caused by false positives on maps.
Warn about the time penalty for trusting the app blindly.
stats_facts: GPS apps (Waze/Google Maps) are currently showing the route as open.
Drivers are seeing 'Open' on their phones while facing 'Road Closed' barricades.
The 'Tasman Trap' is adding an hour to commutes for anyone forced into the U-turn loop.
sections.transition: Once you realize you can't drive through, your instinct will be to call a rideshare, but the old drop-off rules no longer apply.

sections.title: The Rideshare Shuffle: Mercado is the New Front Gate
key_points: Detail the relocation of rideshare zones away from the stadium.
Introduce the 'Mercado Hack' as the superior alternative.
Compare the time cost of sitting in traffic vs. walking.
stats_facts: Rideshare drop-off zones have been pushed back to Mission College Blvd (Mercado Center).
Walking from Mercado Center via the Creek Trail takes ~18 minutes.
Attempting to get closer via car adds ~45 minutes of gridlock time.
sections.transition: If you think you can outsmart the system with a resident pass or a hotel reservation, you need to read the fine print.

sections.title: Mythbusting: Your Pass Won't Save You
key_points: Debunk the idea that resident passes grant thoroughfare access.
Clarify the strict restrictions around the Hilton Santa Clara.
Emphasize the lack of discretion for security personnel.
stats_facts: Resident passes get you into neighborhoods, not through the hard closure zone on Tasman.
The Hilton Santa Clara is inside the hard perimeter; only guests with specific credentials can enter.
Security checkpoints are enforcing a zero-tolerance policy for non-credentialed vehicles.
sections.transition: With the main artery severed and the loopholes closed, there is only one viable route left for locals.

sections.title: The Survival Route: Lick Mill and the Creek
key_points: Identify Lick Mill Blvd as the only functional east-west driving route.
Promote the San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail as the pedestrian bypass.
Summarize the strategy: Drop at Mercado, walk the Creek.
stats_facts: Lick Mill Blvd is the only viable east-west alternative for locals avoiding the highway.
The San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail connects Mercado directly to the stadium perimeter.
This route bypasses the entire Tasman gridlock, saving estimated 40+ minutes.
